00059 /* NOTE: macros not expanded in inline ASM, so values hardcoded */
00060 #define  CVMX_SPINLOCK_UNLOCKED_VAL  0
00061 #define  CVMX_SPINLOCK_LOCKED_VAL    1
00062 
00063 #define CVMX_SPINLOCK_UNLOCKED_INITIALIZER  {CVMX_SPINLOCK_UNLOCKED_VAL}
00064 
00065 #if !defined(CVMX_BUILD_FOR_LINUX_HOST) && defined(__mips__)
00066 /* Spinlocks for Octeon */
00067 
00068 /* define these to enable recursive spinlock debugging */
00069 /* #define CVMX_SPINLOCK_DEBUG */
00070 
00071 /**
00072  * Spinlocks for Octeon
00073  */
00074 typedef struct {
00075     volatile uint32_t value;
00076 } cvmx_spinlock_t;
00077 
00078 
00079 /**
00080  * Initialize a spinlock
00081  *
00082  * @param lock   Lock to initialize
00083  */
00084 static inline void cvmx_spinlock_init(cvmx_spinlock_t * lock)
00085 {
00086     lock->value = CVMX_SPINLOCK_UNLOCKED_VAL;
00087 }
00088 
00089 /**
00090  * Return non-zero if the spinlock is currently locked
00091  *
00092  * @param lock   Lock to check
00093  * @return Non-zero if locked
00094  */ static inline int cvmx_spinlock_locked(cvmx_spinlock_t * lock)
00095 {
00096     return (lock->value != CVMX_SPINLOCK_UNLOCKED_VAL);
00097 }
00098 
00099 /**
00100  * Releases lock
00101  *
00102  * @param lock   pointer to lock structure
00103  */
00104 static inline void cvmx_spinlock_unlock(cvmx_spinlock_t * lock)
00105 {
00106     CVMX_SYNCWS;
00107     lock->value = CVMX_SPINLOCK_UNLOCKED_VAL;
00108     CVMX_SYNCWS;
00109 }
00110 
00111 /**
00112  * Attempts to take the lock, but does not spin if lock is not available.
00113  * May take some time to acquire the lock even if it is available
00114  * due to the ll/sc not succeeding.
00115  *
00116  * @param lock   pointer to lock structure
00117  *
00118  * @return 0: lock successfully taken
00119  *         1: lock not taken, held by someone else
00120  * These return values match the Linux semantics.
00121  */
00122 
00123 static inline unsigned int cvmx_spinlock_trylock(cvmx_spinlock_t * lock)
00124 {
00125     unsigned int tmp;
00126 
00127     __asm__ __volatile__(".set push         \n"
00128                  ".set noreorder         \n"
00129                  "1: ll   %[tmp], %[val] \n"
00130                  "   bnez %[tmp], 2f     \n"  /* if lock held, fail immediately */
00131                  "    li   %[tmp], 1     \n"
00132                  "   sc   %[tmp], %[val] \n"
00133                  "   beqz %[tmp], 1b     \n"
00134                  "    li   %[tmp], 0     \n"
00135                  "2:                     \n"
00136                  ".set pop           \n"
00137                  :[val] "+m"(lock->value),[tmp] "=&r"(tmp)
00138                  ::"memory");
00139 
00140     return (!!tmp); /* normalize to 0 or 1 */
00141 }
00142 
00143 /**
00144  * Gets lock, spins until lock is taken
00145  *
00146  * @param lock   pointer to lock structure
00147  */
00148 static inline void cvmx_spinlock_lock(cvmx_spinlock_t * lock)
00149 {
00150     unsigned int tmp;
00151 
00152     __asm__ __volatile__(".set push         \n"
00153                  ".set noreorder         \n"
00154                  "1: ll   %[tmp], %[val] \n"
00155                  "   bnez %[tmp], 1b     \n"
00156                  "    li   %[tmp], 1     \n"
00157                  "   sc   %[tmp], %[val] \n"
00158                  "   beqz %[tmp], 1b     \n"
00159                  "    nop                \n"
00160                  ".set pop           \n"
00161                  :[val] "+m"(lock->value),[tmp] "=&r"(tmp)
00162                  ::"memory");
00163 
00164 }
00165 
00166 /** ********************************************************************
00167  * Bit spinlocks
00168  * These spinlocks use a single bit (bit 31) of a 32 bit word for locking.
00169  * The rest of the bits in the word are left undisturbed.  This enables more
00170  * compact data structures as only 1 bit is consumed for the lock.
00171  *
00172  */
00173 
00174 /**
00175  * Gets lock, spins until lock is taken
00176  * Preserves the low 31 bits of the 32 bit
00177  * word used for the lock.
00178  *
00179  *
00180  * @param word  word to lock bit 31 of
00181  */
00182 static inline void cvmx_spinlock_bit_lock(uint32_t * word)
00183 {
00184     unsigned int tmp;
00185     unsigned int sav;
00186 
00187     __asm__ __volatile__(".set push         \n"
00188                  ".set noreorder         \n"
00189                  ".set noat              \n"
00190                  "1: ll    %[tmp], %[val]  \n"
00191                  "   bbit1 %[tmp], 31, 1b  \n"
00192                  "    li    $at, 1      \n"
00193                  "   ins   %[tmp], $at, 31, 1  \n"
00194                  "   sc    %[tmp], %[val] \n"
00195                  "   beqz  %[tmp], 1b     \n"
00196                  "    nop                \n"
00197                  ".set pop              \n"
00198                  :[val] "+m"(*word),[tmp] "=&r"(tmp),[sav] "=&r"(sav)
00199                  ::"memory");
00200 
00201 }
00202 
00203 /**
00204  * Attempts to get lock, returns immediately with success/failure
00205  * Preserves the low 31 bits of the 32 bit
00206  * word used for the lock.
00207  *
00208  *
00209  * @param word  word to lock bit 31 of
00210  * @return 0: lock successfully taken
00211  *         1: lock not taken, held by someone else
00212  * These return values match the Linux semantics.
00213  */
00214 static inline unsigned int cvmx_spinlock_bit_trylock(uint32_t * word)
00215 {
00216     unsigned int tmp;
00217 
00218     __asm__ __volatile__(".set push         \n"
00219                  ".set noreorder         \n"
00220                  ".set noat                \n"
00221                  "1: ll    %[tmp], %[val]  \n"
00222                  "    bbit1 %[tmp], 31, 2f \n" /* if lock held, fail immediately */
00223                  "   li    $at, 1      \n"
00224                  "   ins   %[tmp], $at, 31, 1  \n"
00225                  "   sc    %[tmp], %[val]  \n"
00226                  "   beqz  %[tmp], 1b      \n"
00227                  "    li    %[tmp], 0      \n"
00228                  "2:                       \n"
00229                  ".set pop                  \n"
00230                  :[val] "+m"(*word),[tmp] "=&r"(tmp)
00231                  ::"memory");
00232 
00233     return (! !tmp);    /* normalize to 0 or 1 */
00234 }
00235 
00236 /**
00237  * Releases bit lock
00238  *
00239  * Unconditionally clears bit 31 of the lock word.  Note that this is
00240  * done non-atomically, as this implementation assumes that the rest
00241  * of the bits in the word are protected by the lock.
00242  *
00243  * @param word  word to unlock bit 31 in
00244  */
00245 static inline void cvmx_spinlock_bit_unlock(uint32_t * word)
00246 {
00247     CVMX_SYNCWS;
00248     *word &= ~(1UL << 31);
00249     CVMX_SYNCWS;
00250 }
00251 
00252 /** ********************************************************************
00253  * Recursive spinlocks
00254  */
00255 typedef struct {
00256     volatile unsigned int value;
00257     volatile unsigned int core_num;
00258 } cvmx_spinlock_rec_t;
00259 
00260 /**
00261  * Initialize a recursive spinlock
00262  *
00263  * @param lock   Lock to initialize
00264  */
00265 static inline void cvmx_spinlock_rec_init(cvmx_spinlock_rec_t * lock)
00266 {
00267     lock->value = CVMX_SPINLOCK_UNLOCKED_VAL;
00268 }
00269 
00270 /**
00271  * Return non-zero if the recursive spinlock is currently locked
00272  *
00273  * @param lock   Lock to check
00274  * @return Non-zero if locked
00275  */
00276 static inline int cvmx_spinlock_rec_locked(cvmx_spinlock_rec_t * lock)
00277 {
00278     return (lock->value != CVMX_SPINLOCK_UNLOCKED_VAL);
00279 }
00280 
00281 /**
00282 * Unlocks one level of recursive spinlock.  Lock is not unlocked
00283 * unless this is the final unlock call for that spinlock
00284 *
00285 * @param lock   ptr to recursive spinlock structure
00286 */
00287 static inline void cvmx_spinlock_rec_unlock(cvmx_spinlock_rec_t * lock);
00288 
00289 #ifdef CVMX_SPINLOCK_DEBUG
00290 #define cvmx_spinlock_rec_unlock(x)  _int_cvmx_spinlock_rec_unlock((x), __FILE__, __LINE__)
00291 static inline void _int_cvmx_spinlock_rec_unlock(cvmx_spinlock_rec_t * lock, char *filename, int linenum)
00292 #else
00293 static inline void cvmx_spinlock_rec_unlock(cvmx_spinlock_rec_t * lock)
00294 #endif
00295 {
00296 
00297     unsigned int temp, result;
00298     int core_num;
00299     core_num = cvmx_get_core_num();
00300 
00301 #ifdef CVMX_SPINLOCK_DEBUG
00302     {
00303         if (lock->core_num != core_num) {
00304             cvmx_dprintf("ERROR: Recursive spinlock release attemped by non-owner! file: %s, line: %d\n", filename, linenum);
00305             return;
00306         }
00307     }
00308 #endif
00309 
00310     __asm__ __volatile__(".set push         \n"
00311                  ".set noreorder         \n"
00312                  "     addi  %[tmp], %[pid], 0x80 \n"
00313                  "     sw    %[tmp], %[lid]       # set lid to invalid value\n"
00314                  CVMX_SYNCWS_STR
00315                  "1:   ll    %[tmp], %[val]       \n"
00316                  "     addu  %[res], %[tmp], -1   # decrement lock count\n"
00317                  "     sc    %[res], %[val]       \n"
00318                  "      beqz  %[res], 1b          \n"
00319                  "     nop                        \n"
00320                  "     beq   %[tmp], %[res], 2f   # res is 1 on successful sc       \n"
00321                  "      nop                       \n"
00322                  "     sw   %[pid], %[lid]        # set lid to pid, only if lock still held\n"
00323                  "2:                         \n"
00324                  CVMX_SYNCWS_STR
00325                  ".set  pop                   \n"
00326                  :[res] "=&r"(result),[tmp] "=&r"(temp),[val] "+m"(lock->value),[lid] "+m"(lock->core_num)
00327                  :[pid] "r"(core_num)
00328                  :"memory");
00329 
00330 #ifdef CVMX_SPINLOCK_DEBUG
00331     {
00332         if (lock->value == ~0UL) {
00333             cvmx_dprintf("ERROR: Recursive spinlock released too many times! file: %s, line: %d\n", filename, linenum);
00334         }
00335     }
00336 #endif
00337 
00338 }
00339 
00340 /**
00341  * Takes recursive spinlock for a given core.  A core can take the lock multiple
00342  * times, and the lock is released only when the corresponding number of
00343  * unlocks have taken place.
00344  *
00345  * NOTE: This assumes only one thread per core, and that the core ID is used as
00346  * the lock 'key'.  (This implementation cannot be generalized to allow
00347  * multiple threads to use the same key (core id) .)
00348  *
00349  * @param lock   address of recursive spinlock structure.  Note that this is
00350  *               distinct from the standard spinlock
00351  */
00352 static inline void cvmx_spinlock_rec_lock(cvmx_spinlock_rec_t * lock);
00353 
00354 #ifdef CVMX_SPINLOCK_DEBUG
00355 #define cvmx_spinlock_rec_lock(x)  _int_cvmx_spinlock_rec_lock((x), __FILE__, __LINE__)
00356 static inline void _int_cvmx_spinlock_rec_lock(cvmx_spinlock_rec_t * lock, char *filename, int linenum)
00357 #else
00358 static inline void cvmx_spinlock_rec_lock(cvmx_spinlock_rec_t * lock)
00359 #endif
00360 {
00361 
00362     volatile unsigned int tmp;
00363     volatile int core_num;
00364 
00365     core_num = cvmx_get_core_num();
00366 
00367     __asm__ __volatile__(".set push         \n"
00368                  ".set noreorder         \n"
00369                  "1: ll   %[tmp], %[val]       # load the count\n"
00370                  "   bnez %[tmp], 2f           # if count!=zero branch to 2\n"
00371                  "    addu %[tmp], %[tmp], 1   \n"
00372                  "   sc   %[tmp], %[val]       \n"
00373                  "   beqz %[tmp], 1b           # go back if not success\n"
00374                  "    nop                      \n"
00375                  "   j    3f                   # go to write core_num \n"
00376                  "2: lw   %[tmp], %[lid]       # load the core_num \n"
00377                  "   bne  %[tmp], %[pid], 1b   # core_num no match, restart\n"
00378                  "    nop                      \n"
00379                  "   lw   %[tmp], %[val]       \n"
00380                  "   addu %[tmp], %[tmp], 1    \n"
00381                  "   sw   %[tmp], %[val]       # update the count\n"
00382                  "3: sw   %[pid], %[lid]       # store the core_num\n"
00383                  CVMX_SYNCWS_STR
00384                  ".set  pop                \n"
00385                  :[tmp] "=&r"(tmp),[val] "+m"(lock->value),[lid] "+m"(lock->core_num)
00386                  :[pid] "r"(core_num)
00387                  :"memory");
00388 
00389 #ifdef CVMX_SPINLOCK_DEBUG
00390     if (lock->core_num != core_num) {
00391         cvmx_dprintf("cvmx_spinlock_rec_lock: lock taken, but core_num is incorrect. file: %s, line: %d\n", filename, linenum);
00392     }
00393 #endif
00394 
00395 }
00396 
00397 #else
00398 
00399 #   define cvmx_spinlock_lock cvmx_atomic_spinlock_lock
00400 #   define cvmx_spinlock_unlock cvmx_atomic_spinlock_unlock
00401     /* do not use spinlock when defined(CVMX_BUILD_FOR_LINUX_HOST)
00402      * but still define the structure for binary compatibility
00403      */
00404     typedef struct { volatile uint32_t value; } cvmx_spinlock_t;
00405 
00406 #endif

00410 
00411 /*
00412  * New style spinlock implementation using C11 standard atomic
00413  * operations.
00414  * This spinlock is much faster and fair.
00415  * Note these can be used on the host or target but they require
00416  * GCC 4.7 and above.
00417  * @EXPERIMENTAL
00418  */
00419 
00420 /* This is only supported for GCC 4.7 and above.  */
00421 #if (__GNUC__ > 4) || (__GNUC__ == 4 && __GNUC_MINOR__ >= 7)
00422 
00423 /* Include stdatomic if we are using C11 toolchain.  */
00424 #if defined(__GNUC__) && !defined(__HAS_ATOMIC)
00425 # if (__GNUC__ > 4) || (__GNUC__ == 4 && __GNUC_MINOR__ >= 9)
00426 #  include <stdatomic.h>
00427 #  define __HAS_ATOMIC
00428 # endif
00429 #endif
00430 
00431 #ifndef __HAS_ATOMIC
00432 /* Used for readability from C11, define our own versions.
00433  * Documentation on the atomic functions built into GCC 4.7 found here:
00434  * http://gcc.gnu.org/onlinedocs/gcc-4.7.0/gcc/_005f_005fatomic-Builtins.html
00435  */
00436 #undef _Atomic
00437 #define _Atomic
00438 #define atomic_fetch_sub_explicit(PTR,VAL,AMM) \
00439   __atomic_fetch_sub ((PTR), (VAL), (AMM))
00440 #define atomic_fetch_add_explicit(PTR,VAL,AMM) \
00441   __atomic_fetch_add ((PTR), (VAL), (AMM))
00442 #define atomic_store_explicit(PTR,VAL,AMM) \
00443   __atomic_store_n((PTR), (VAL), (AMM))
00444 #define atomic_exchange_explicit(PTR,VAL,AMM) \
00445   __atomic_exchange_n((PTR), (VAL), (AMM))
00446 #define atomic_compare_exchange_strong_explicit(PTR,EXP,DES,SUCC,FAIL) \
00447   (__atomic_compare_exchange_n((PTR),(EXP),(DES),1,(SUCC),FAIL))
00448 #define atomic_load_explicit(PTR,AMM) __atomic_load_n((PTR), (AMM))
00449 
00450 #define memory_order_seq_cst __ATOMIC_SEQ_CST
00451 #define memory_order_acquire __ATOMIC_ACQUIRE
00452 #define memory_order_release __ATOMIC_RELEASE
00453 #define memory_order_relaxed __ATOMIC_RELAXED
00454 
00455 #endif /* !__HAS_ATOMIC */
00456 
00457 /*
00458  * Atomic fair spinlock type
00459  *
00460  * Two atomic 64-bit counters are used.
00461  * When the counters are equal, the spinlock is free.
00462  * A lock operation increments the 'ticket_waiter" counter,
00463  * and waits until 'ticket_server' catches up to the pre-increment
00464  * value of the 'ticket_waiter'
00465  * An unlock operation increments 'ticket_server'.
00466  */
00467 typedef struct {
00468     _Atomic unsigned long long
00469         ticket_waiter, ticket_server;
00470 } cvmx_atomic_spinlock_t;
00471 
00472 #define CVMX_ATOMIC_SPINLOCK_UNLOCKED_INITIALIZER \
00473     ((cvmx_atomic_spinlock_t) {0ull, 0ull})
00474 
00475 /**
00476  * Initialize a spinlock to unlocked state
00477  */
00478 static inline void cvmx_atomic_spinlock_init(cvmx_atomic_spinlock_t *lock)
00479 {
00480     atomic_store_explicit(&lock->ticket_waiter, 0, memory_order_relaxed);
00481     atomic_store_explicit(&lock->ticket_server, 0, memory_order_release);
00482 }
00483 
00484 /**
00485  * Check if a spinlock is busy
00486  *
00487  * @return non-zero if the spinlock is busy, 0 if it is free
00488  */
00489 static inline int cvmx_atomic_spinlock_locked(cvmx_atomic_spinlock_t * lock)
00490 {
00491     unsigned long long ticket;
00492 
00493     ticket =
00494         atomic_load_explicit(&lock->ticket_server,
00495         memory_order_relaxed);
00496 
00497     return
00498         ticket !=
00499             atomic_load_explicit(&lock->ticket_waiter,
00500             memory_order_acquire);
00501 }
00502 
00503 /**
00504  * Acquire a lock, wait if needed
00505  *
00506  */
00507 static inline void cvmx_atomic_spinlock_lock(cvmx_atomic_spinlock_t *lock)
00508 {
00509     unsigned long long ticket;
00510 
00511     ticket = atomic_fetch_add_explicit(&lock->ticket_waiter, 1,
00512         memory_order_relaxed);
00513 
00514     while (ticket != atomic_load_explicit(&lock->ticket_server,
00515         memory_order_acquire))
00516         /* do nothing */ ;
00517 
00518 }
00519 
00520 /**
00521  * Release a lock
00522  *
00523  */
00524 static inline void cvmx_atomic_spinlock_unlock(cvmx_atomic_spinlock_t * lock)
00525 {
00526     /* Previous value not needed, but this is the only standard add call */
00527     (void) atomic_fetch_add_explicit(&lock->ticket_server, 1,
00528         memory_order_release);
00529 }
00530 
00531 /**
00532  * Try to acquire the lock without blocking
00533  *
00534  * @return 0 on soccess
00535  *         1: lock not taken, held by someone else
00536  *
00537  */
00538 static inline int cvmx_atomic_spinlock_trylock(cvmx_atomic_spinlock_t *lock)
00539 {
00540     unsigned long long waiter, server;
00541 
00542     waiter = atomic_load_explicit(&lock->ticket_waiter,
00543         memory_order_acquire);
00544     server = atomic_load_explicit(&lock->ticket_server,
00545         memory_order_acquire);
00546 
00547     /* If tickets differ, the lock is busy */
00548     if (waiter != server)
00549         return 1;
00550 
00551     /* If 'ticket_waiter" has moved since the first load,
00552      * it means at least that someone tried to acquire the lock,
00553      * so we lose.
00554      * If nobody touched it, means it is still free, and we
00555      * take the lock by incremebting it.
00556      */
00557     return (!atomic_compare_exchange_strong_explicit(
00558             &lock->ticket_waiter,
00559             &waiter, waiter+1,
00560             memory_order_seq_cst, memory_order_relaxed));
00561 }
00562 
00563 #endif
00564 
00565 
00566 #ifdef  __cplusplus
00567 /* *INDENT-OFF* */
00568 }
00569 /* *INDENT-ON* */
00570 #endif
00571 
00572 #endif /* __CVMX_SPINLOCK_H__ */
